verses.verse: Then Joseph<WH3130> came<WH935> and told<WH5046> Pharaoh<WH6547>, and said<WH559>, My father<WH1> and my brethren<WH251>, and their flocks<WH6629>, and their herds<WH1241>, and all that they have, are come out<WH935> of the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>; and, behold, they are in the land<WH776> of Goshen<WH1657>.
And he took<WH3947> some<WH7097> of his brethren<WH251>, even five<WH2568> men<WH582>, and presented<WH3322> them unto<WH6440> Pharaoh<WH6547>.

And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> unto his brethren<WH251>, What is your occupation<WH4639>? And they said<WH559> unto Pharaoh<WH6547>, Thy servants<WH5650> are shepherds<WH7462> <WH6629>, both we, and also our fathers<WH1>.

They said<WH559> moreover unto Pharaoh<WH6547>, For to sojourn<WH1481> in the land<WH776> are we come<WH935>; for thy servants<WH5650> have no pasture<WH4829> for their flocks<WH6629>; for the famine<WH7458> is sore<WH3515> in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>: now therefore, we pray thee, let thy servants<WH5650> dwell<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Goshen<WH1657>.
And Pharaoh<WH6547> spake<WH559> unto Joseph<WH3130>, saying<WH559>, Thy father<WH1> and thy brethren<WH251> are come<WH935> unto thee:

The land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> is before thee<WH6440>; in the best<WH4315> of the land<WH776> make<WH3427> thy father<WH1> and brethren<WH251> to dwell<WH3427>; in the land<WH776> of Goshen<WH1657> let them dwell<WH3427>: and if thou knowest<WH3045> <WH3426> any men<WH582> of activity<WH2428> among them, then make them<WH7760> rulers<WH8269> over my cattle<WH4735>.
And Joseph<WH3130> brought in<WH935> Jacob<WH3290> his father<WH1>, and set him<WH5975> before<WH6440> Pharaoh<WH6547>: and Jacob<WH3290> blessed<WH1288> Pharaoh<WH6547>.
And Pharaoh<WH6547> said<WH559> unto Jacob<WH3290>, How<WH4100> old<WH2416> <WH3117> <WH8141> art thou? How: Heb. How many are the days of the years of thy life?

And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> unto Pharaoh<WH6547>, The days<WH3117> of the years<WH8141> of my pilgrimage<WH4033> are an hundred<WH3967> and thirty<WH7970> years<WH8141>: few<WH4592> and evil<WH7451> have the days<WH3117> of the years<WH8141> of my life<WH2416> been, and have not attained<WH5381> unto the days<WH3117> of the years<WH8141> of the life<WH2416> of my fathers<WH1> in the days<WH3117> of their pilgrimage<WH4033>.
And Jacob<WH3290> blessed<WH1288> Pharaoh<WH6547>, and went out<WH3318> from before<WH6440> Pharaoh<WH6547>.

And Joseph<WH3130> placed<WH3427> his father<WH1> and his brethren<WH251>, and gave<WH5414> them a possession<WH272> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, in the best<WH4315> of the land<WH776>, in the land<WH776> of Rameses<WH7486>, as Pharaoh<WH6547> had commanded<WH6680>.

And Joseph<WH3130> nourished<WH3557> his father<WH1>, and his brethren<WH251>, and all his father's<WH1> household<WH1004>, with bread<WH3899>, according<WH6310> to their families<WH2945>. according: or, as a little child is nourished: Heb. according to the little ones

And there was no bread<WH3899> in all the land<WH776>; for the famine<WH7458> was very<WH3966> sore<WH3515>, so that the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> and all the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667> fainted<WH3856> by reason<WH6440> of the famine<WH7458>.

And Joseph<WH3130> gathered up<WH3950> all the money<WH3701> that was found<WH4672> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, for the corn<WH7668> which they bought<WH7666>: and Joseph<WH3130> brought<WH935> the money<WH3701> into Pharaoh's<WH6547> house<WH1004>.

And when money<WH3701> failed<WH8552> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, and in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, all the Egyptians<WH4714> came<WH935> unto Joseph<WH3130>, and said<WH559>, Give<WH3051> us bread<WH3899>: for why should we die<WH4191> in thy presence? for the money<WH3701> faileth<WH656>.
And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559>, Give<WH3051> your cattle<WH4735>; and I will give<WH5414> you for your cattle<WH4735>, if money<WH3701> fail<WH656>.

And they brought<WH935> their cattle<WH4735> unto Joseph<WH3130>: and Joseph<WH3130> gave<WH5414> them bread<WH3899> in exchange for horses<WH5483>, and for the flocks<WH6629>, and for the cattle<WH4735> of the herds<WH1241>, and for the asses<WH2543>: and he fed<WH5095> them with bread<WH3899> for all their cattle<WH4735> for that year<WH8141>. fed: Heb. led them

When that year<WH8141> was ended<WH8552>, they came<WH935> unto him the second<WH8145> year<WH8141>, and said<WH559> unto him, We will not hide<WH3582> it from my lord<WH113>, how that our money<WH3701> is spent<WH8552>; my lord<WH113> also hath<WH413> our herds<WH4735> of cattle<WH929>; there is not ought left<WH7604> in the sight<WH6440> of my lord<WH113>, but our bodies<WH1472>, and our lands<WH127>:

Wherefore shall we die<WH4191> before thine eyes<WH5869>, both we and our land<WH127>? buy<WH7069> us and our land<WH127> for bread<WH3899>, and we and our land<WH127> will be servants<WH5650> unto Pharaoh<WH6547>: and give<WH5414> us seed<WH2233>, that we may live<WH2421>, and not die<WH4191>, that the land<WH127> be not desolate<WH3456>.

And Joseph<WH3130> bought<WH7069> all the land<WH127> of Egypt<WH4714> for Pharaoh<WH6547>; for the Egyptians<WH4714> sold<WH4376> every man<WH376> his field<WH7704>, because the famine<WH7458> prevailed<WH2388> over them: so the land<WH776> became Pharaoh's<WH6547>.
And as for the people<WH5971>, he removed<WH5674> them to cities<WH5892> from one end<WH7097> of the borders<WH1366> of Egypt<WH4714> even to the other end<WH7097> thereof.

Only the land<WH127> of the priests<WH3548> bought he<WH7069> not; for the priests<WH3548> had a portion<WH2706> assigned them of Pharaoh<WH6547>, and did eat<WH398> their portion<WH2706> which Pharaoh<WH6547> gave<WH5414> them: wherefore they sold<WH4376> not their lands<WH127>. priests: or, princes

Then Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto the people<WH5971>, Behold, I have bought<WH7069> <WH853> you this day<WH3117> and your land<WH127> for Pharaoh<WH6547>: lo<WH1887>, here is seed<WH2233> for you, and ye shall sow<WH2232> the land<WH127>.

And it shall come to pass in the increase<WH8393>, that ye shall give<WH5414> the fifth<WH2549> part unto Pharaoh<WH6547>, and four<WH702> parts<WH3027> shall be your own, for seed<WH2233> of the field<WH7704>, and for your food<WH400>, and for them of your households<WH1004>, and for food<WH398> for your little ones<WH2945>.
And they said<WH559>, Thou hast saved our lives<WH2421>: let us find<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of my lord<WH113>, and we will be Pharaoh's<WH6547> servants<WH5650>.

And Joseph<WH3130> made<WH7760> it a law<WH2706> over the land<WH127> of Egypt<WH4714> unto this day<WH3117>, that Pharaoh<WH6547> should have the fifth<WH2569> part; except<WH7535> the land<WH127> of the priests<WH3548> only, which became not Pharaoh's<WH6547>. priests: or, princes

And Israel<WH3478> dwelt<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, in the country<WH776> of Goshen<WH1657>; and they had possessions<WH270> therein, and grew<WH6509>, and multiplied<WH7235> exceedingly<WH3966>.

And Jacob<WH3290> lived<WH2421> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> seventeen<WH6240> <WH7651> years<WH8141>: so the whole age<WH2416> <WH3117> of Jacob<WH3290> was an hundred<WH3967> forty<WH705> <WH8141> and seven<WH7651> years<WH8141>. the whole: Heb. the days of the years of his life

And the time<WH3117> drew nigh<WH7126> that Israel<WH3478> must die<WH4191>: and he called<WH7121> his son<WH1121> Joseph<WH3130>, and said<WH559> unto him, If now I have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in thy sight<WH5869>, put<WH7760>, I pray thee, thy hand<WH3027> under my thigh<WH3409>, and deal<WH6213> kindly<WH2617> and truly<WH571> with me; bury<WH6912> me not, I pray thee, in Egypt<WH4714>:

But I will lie<WH7901> with my fathers<WH1>, and thou shalt carry<WH5375> me out of Egypt<WH4714>, and bury<WH6912> me in their buryingplace<WH6900>. And he said<WH559>, I will do<WH6213> as thou hast said<WH1697>.
And he said<WH559>, Swear<WH7650> unto me. And he sware<WH7650> unto him. And Israel<WH3478> bowed<WH7812> himself upon the bed's<WH4296> head<WH7218>.
